chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall n : nat, mon n -> nat

Premises:
Inductive mon : nat -> Set := n_0 : mon 0 | c_n : forall d : nat, nat -> mon d -> mon (S d) Arguments mon _%nat_scope Arguments c_n (_ _)%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
mon_sind : forall P : forall n : nat, mon n -> SProp, P 0 n_0 -> (forall (d n : nat) (m : mon d), P d m -> P (S d) (c_n d n m)) -> forall (n : nat) (m : mon n), P n m
mon_ind : forall P : forall n : nat, mon n -> Prop, P 0 n_0 -> (forall (d n : nat) (m : mon d), P d m -> P (S d) (c_n d n m)) -> forall (n : nat) (m : mon n), P n m
mon_rec : forall P : forall n : nat, mon n -> Set, P 0 n_0 -> (forall (d n : nat) (m : mon d), P d m -> P (S d) (c_n d n m)) -> forall (n : nat) (m : mon n), P n m
mon_rect : forall P : forall n : nat, mon n -> Type, P 0 n_0 -> (forall (d n : nat) (m : mon d), P d m -> P (S d) (c_n d n m)) -> forall (n : nat) (m : mon n), P n m
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0 -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
nat_rec : forall P : nat -> Set, P 0 -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
Nat.right_induction : forall A : nat -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall z : nat, A z -> (forall n : nat, z <= n -> A n -> A (S n)) -> forall n : nat, z <= n -> A n
Nat.order_induction : forall A : nat -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall z : nat, A z -> (forall n : nat, z <= n -> A n -> A (S n)) -> (forall n : nat, n < z -> A (S n) -> A n) -> forall n : nat, A n
orderc_sind : forall P : forall n : nat, mon n -> mon n -> SProp, (forall (n a b : nat) (p : mon n), b < a -> P (S n) (c_n n a p) (c_n n b p)) -> (forall (n a b : nat) (p q : mon n), orderc n p q -> P n p q -> P (S n) (c_n n a p) (c_n n b q)) -> forall (n : nat) (m m0 : mon n), orderc n m m0 -> P n m m0
orderc_ind : forall P : forall n : nat, mon n -> mon n -> Prop, (forall (n a b : nat) (p : mon n), b < a -> P (S n) (c_n n a p) (c_n n b p)) -> (forall (n a b : nat) (p q : mon n), orderc n p q -> P n p q -> P (S n) (c_n n a p) (c_n n b q)) -> forall (n : nat) (m m0 : mon n), orderc n m m0 -> P n m m0
Nat.left_induction : forall A : nat -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall z : nat, A z -> (forall n : nat, n < z -> A (S n) -> A n) -> forall n : nat, n <= z -> A n
Nat.A'A_right : forall (A : nat -> Prop) (z : nat), (forall n m : nat, z <= m -> m < n -> A m) -> forall n : nat, z <= n -> A n
Nat.bi_induction : forall A : nat -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> A 0 -> (forall n : nat, A n <-> A (S n)) -> forall n : nat, A n
Nat.case_analysis : forall A : nat -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> A 0 -> (forall n : nat, A (S n)) -> forall n : nat, A n
le_elim_rel : forall P : nat -> nat -> Prop, (forall p : nat, P 0 p) -> (forall p q : nat, p <= q -> P p q -> P (S p) (S q)) -> forall n m : nat, n <= m -> P n m
Inductive orderc : forall n : nat, mon n -> mon n -> Prop := lo1 : forall (n a b : nat) (p : mon n), b < a -> orderc (S n) (c_n n a p) (c_n n b p) | lo2 : forall (n a b : nat) (p q : mon n), orderc n p q -> orderc (S n) (c_n n a p) (c_n n b q) Arguments orderc _%nat_scope Arguments lo1 (_ _ _)%nat_scope Arguments lo2 (_ _ _)%nat_scope
le_ind : forall (n : nat) (P : nat -> Prop), P n -> (forall m : nat, n <= m -> P m -> P (S m)) -> forall n0 : nat, n <= n0 -> P n0
Nat.eqf = fun f g : nat -> bool => forall n : nat, f n = g n : (nat -> bool) -> (nat -> bool) -> Prop Arguments Nat.eqf (_ _)%function_scope
mdiv_ind : forall P : forall d : nat, mon d -> mon d -> Prop, P 0 n_0 n_0 -> (forall (d : nat) (v v' : mon d) (n n' : nat), n <= n' -> mdiv d v v' -> P d v v' -> P (S d) (c_n d n v) (c_n d n' v')) -> forall (d : nat) (m m0 : mon d), mdiv d m m0 -> P d m m0
mdiv_sind : forall P : forall d : nat, mon d -> mon d -> SProp, P 0 n_0 n_0 -> (forall (d : nat) (v v' : mon d) (n n' : nat), n <= n' -> mdiv d v v' -> P d v v' -> P (S d) (c_n d n v) (c_n d n' v')) -> forall (d : nat) (m m0 : mon d), mdiv d m m0 -> P d m m0
c_n : forall d : nat, nat -> mon d -> mon (S d)
Inductive mdiv : forall d : nat, mon d -> mon d -> Prop := mdiv_nil : mdiv 0 n_0 n_0 | mdiv_cons : forall (d : nat) (v v' : mon d) (n n' : nat), n <= n' -> mdiv d v v' -> mdiv (S d) (c_n d n v) (c_n d n' v') Arguments mdiv _%nat_scope Arguments mdiv_cons _%nat_scope _ _ (_ _)%nat_scope
Inductive mon : nat -> Set := n_0 : mon 0 | c_n : forall d : nat, nat -> mon d -> mon (S d) Arguments mon _%nat_scope Arguments c_n (_ _)%nat_scope
Inductive le (n : nat) : nat -> Prop := le_n : n <= n | le_S : forall m : nat, n <= m -> n <= S m Arguments le (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments le_n _%nat_scope Arguments le_S (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.divide_antisym : forall n m : nat, Nat.divide n m -> Nat.divide m n -> n = m

```coq
intros n Hn.
induction Hn using mon_ind.
- exact 0.
- simpl. apply S. assumption.
Qed.
```

original: intros n Hn. induction Hn using mon_ind. - apply 0. - simpl. apply S. auto.
